summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the Southern District of New York on August 27, 2020, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear on September 24, 2020, to testify and produce documents regarding alleged violations of federal statutes related to sex trafficking and other crimes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to maintain confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued by the Acting U.S. Attorney's office in the Southern District of New York.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), 371 (conspiracy), and 1623 (false statements).
The recipient is commanded to appear on September 24, 2020, at 10:00 a.m. and to produce items listed in an attached rider.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document includes standard grand jury advice of rights, including the right to refuse to answer self-incriminating questions and the right to consult with an attorney.
